titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Sons of the American Revolution, Gen. William Floyd Chapter records 1978.057
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-17T15:41-0500

did.unittitle: Sons of the American Revolution, Gen. William Floyd Chapter records
did.abstract: These records measure 0.1 linear feet and span the period 1959 to 1969. They include memos, fliers, membership lists, and correspondence of the Gen. William Floyd Chapter of the Sons of the American Revolution, based in the New York City area.

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Sons of the American Revolution. Gen. William Floyd Chapter.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Sons of the American Revolution, Gen. William Floyd Chapter records, 1978.057, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The papers were formally accessioned in 1978.
